availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William T. Estep (Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, bookkeeper)

body.p: Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, bookkeeper. Kentucky native. Son of William H. Estep and Elizabeth Estep. Married to Vicy Gibson Estep in Lawrence County, Kentucky, on April 14, 1865. Attended school in Mason County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned two enslaved persons in Mason County in 1850. Bookkeeper in Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 1, p. 23B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, p. 589.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Floyd County, District 7, p. 596A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Lawrence County Marriages, Film 000840550, p. 93.
